utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: On one knee?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's a good girl.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What's up Castle? You proposing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no. Just waiting for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's too bad. You two make a cute couple.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Hey, you think I should get a dog?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What am I, your wife?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, you're my work wife.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I'm not your work wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I could get a bloodhound. I could name him Sherlock, and then I could-- I could bring him to crime scenes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you couldn't.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, what? It'd be adorable. I could get him to wear a little Sherlock hat, train him how to carry a little magnifying glass. Oh, see? Right there. Disapproving, judgmental. You're totally my work wife. Hmm. The blood's bold, but it works.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not sure he'd agree.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. Well, obviously, he was into art.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Victor Fink, 43, gallery owner. There's no sign of forced entry. Tenant upstairs called in gunshots to 911 at 10:14 p.m.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea what he was doing here so late?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, but according to his assistant, Darius Langley, they close at eight. As far as he can tell, there's nothing missing off the walls or from the back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything off those security cameras?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Fake. Not even hooked up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lucky break for the guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless he knew. Just like he knew Fink was working late.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or made plans to meet him here. Check with the assistant.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He had some fight in him. Abrasions on the forearms, on the hands.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then he made a run for the stairs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only to be shot in the back.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Twice, 9 millimeter. Shooter fired from over here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is it possible he might have been meeting somebody?

utterance.speaker: DARIUS LANGLEY
utterance.content: Well, if he was meeting someone, he didn't tell me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me for a minute.

utterance.speaker: DARIUS LANGLEY
utterance.content: He'd already left by the time I locked up at eight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Langley? I'm Detective Kate Beckett. How long have you been Mr. Fink's assistant?

utterance.speaker: DARIUS LANGLEY
utterance.content: Two months. I'm an art student. I take night classes at Tisch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that where you were tonight?

utterance.speaker: DARIUS LANGLEY
utterance.content: Yeah. Mr. Fink totally supported me being in school, he'd let me leave early to make classes. That's where I was when you guys called.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know if Mr. Fink had any enemies? Any unhappy clients or artists?

utterance.speaker: DARIUS LANGLEY
utterance.content: Nothing out of the ordinary. I can get you a contact list, if you like.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, please.

utterance.speaker: DARIUS LANGLEY
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. We got a little problem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm-hmm?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We dug these two slugs out of the wall.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They're not very fragmented. See if ballistics can run a match on any of the other shootings in the city.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sure, but that's not the problem. We dug these two out of the wall and Dr. Parish has another two in our vic here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, our perp's not a sharpshooter.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But we've only found four bullets, and there are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 shell casings on the ground.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There's no blood trail leading out of here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Exactly. And not a drop of blood outside of the spatter from our vic here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, there's no second victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, where's the fifth bullet?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The bullet was made of ice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Great. Yeah, send her up. Vic's wife is on her way up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fires the bullet, it melts before we can find it. An ice bullet! Hello? An ice bullet? Are you even paying attention to me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No! You aren't saying anything worth paying attention to.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Uniforms are still canvassing, but so far they still haven't found any blood trails outside the gallery.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And CSU's re-swept the scene twice. No sign of our fifth bullet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm telling you. Ice bullet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nah, bro. An ice bullet would still make a bullet hole.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You mean, ice hole.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did you just call me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Guys. What else?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We checked Fink's cell phone records. He got a call at 9:19 p.m., an hour before he was killed, from a blocked cell phone number.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Phone records indicate that the call originated here in New York, but it was an international cell, satellite phone, registered to Bahrain Cellular.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, good luck getting a warrant from the government of Bahrain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Run down Fink's client and artist list. See if any of them had international numbers and watch your mouth.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I'm gonna go 10-1.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER MARINO
utterance.content: Hey, Ryan. Got a sec?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Witness?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER MARINO
utterance.content: Not exactly. Hang here, buddy, okay?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER MARINO
utterance.content: I found him on the canvass, by the art gallery. I mean, the guy's got no wallet, no ID.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, did you ask him his name?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER MARINO
utterance.content: Yeah, I asked him his name, I asked him where he lived. You know, but here's the funny part. The guy says he don't remember.

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA FINK
utterance.content: Did my husband have enemies? Yeah, he had enemies. Every artist who couldn't get in his gallery, and every artist who was in his gallery. He'd sell, like, five pieces, and they'd want to know why he didn't sell six.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Fink, I know you're upset.

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA FINK
utterance.content: Well, what am I supposed to do with these, huh?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA FINK
utterance.content: I didn't want them. I did them for him, and now he's dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mrs. Fink, can you think of anyone who would hate your husband enough to shoot him in cold blood in the back?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA FINK
utterance.content: Rocco.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Rocco? Was that one of the artists?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA FINK
utterance.content: His assistant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought Darius was his assistant.

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA FINK
utterance.content: His old assistant. Victor fired Rocco a few months back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA FINK
utterance.content: He fired that little insect over money. And, boy, did Rocco go crazy, making all kinds of threats. "I'm gonna get you, Fink." But you know what, no. Rocco, he wasn't even a man. He was more like a flea. Victor didn't even think twice about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You suppose the flea had a gun? A tiny gun with vanishing bullets?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ice bullets and fleas with guns? Do you have writer's block again?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stephen King wrote stories of bloodthirsty cars and sold millions of copies. I figure, why be limited by logic?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Rocco Jones, Fink's old assistant. The wife said that Rocco called and left threatening messages for Fink. See what you can find.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I'm on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, what's up with Ryan?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mugging case. The guy got hit on the head and can't remember who he is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, missing bullets are cool, amnesia's even cooler.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: I'm sure you have better things to do. I'm sure I do, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: An inhaler. You're asthmatic.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Awesome.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You should probably hang onto that.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Inhaler, grocery bag, keys.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Are you telling me you don't remember, at all, what any of that's for?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Yeah. How ridiculous is that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Hey. So, has he, uh, really got amnesia?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Yeah. But apparently my hearing's fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that's good. Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Hi... I'd introduce myself, too, but...

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, we're just going through his pockets trying to find something that could tell us who he is.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Oh, and apparently I've been reading, as well.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, Crime and Punishment. Dostoyevsky. Classic. You have excellent taste.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: 9 millimeter. I think we just found our fifth bullet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what, if we get a dog, I could buy him little saddlebags, and then he could carry your books to school, and you wouldn't have to worry about getting scoliosis.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Conceptually, I'd like a dog as much as you would. In reality, I'm not seeing the guy whose dishes never make it to the sink bending over to scoop poop in Hudson Park.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet I could train him to use a toilet.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gram! I thought you were just sleeping in.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I was, just not in my room.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You know what? We all share way too much.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry, kiddo. But my happiness cannot be contained.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I'm going to school. I'm glad you had a nice date.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes, three, four, five...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm assuming from this walk of shame, that you and your high school sweetheart, Chet, had a lovely night, all night, talking.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Among other things.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm. It's been a few weeks. Do I need to sit him down and ask him his intentions?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I am having way too much fun to worry about his intentions. Okay, took me for lovely candlelight dinner, horse and carriage ride through Central Park where we watched the sun rise over the same boulder where we shared our first kiss.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, that's still his make-out spot? Mother, that's a red flag.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Honey, nothing you can say can spoil this for me. I haven't felt this way since... I can't remember when.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, amnesia. It's going around. Speaking of which, I'm off. I'd tell you not to wait up, but clearly there would be no point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His fingerprints aren't in the system, and we don't have any hits on Missing Persons.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is crazy. We actually find a witness to our murder, and we don't know who he is and he doesn't remember what he saw.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are we on Rocco?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Fink's old assistant? Uniforms are bringing him in now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ballistics confirms that the bullets came from the same gun as the others. Whatever happened in the gallery, he was there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not only was he there, but someone tried to kill him, as well. Good thing he reads.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Good thing he reads Russian literature. If the guy was a Nicholas Sparks fan, he'd be dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have CSU check the coat for gunpowder residue, blood, fibers. Maybe it can tell us what happened that night. And check photo IDs on Fink's artists and clients.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Think he might be one of them?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A girl can dream.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I brought you coffee.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, what's the problem, Doc?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: So, like, if I were a betting man, which I have no idea if I am, would I put my money on my memory coming back, or not?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do we know why this would have happened?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Trauma?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You did get shot. Could that be it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If we took him back to the scene of the crime, could that jog his memory?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of course. I'll need to ask a few questions first. Mr... I'm sorry, I don't even know what to call you.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: I don't know what to call me, either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said his procedural memory is intact?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: May I?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Well, that's freaky. How the hell did I do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That looks like a real signature.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You form neural pathways. Procedural memory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, he can't remember his name, but he can sign it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's illegible. Maybe you're a doctor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His first initial looks like a "J." Does that ring a bell?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe we should just call you J.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: J. It's as good as anything, I guess.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you recognize this man?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: No. Should I?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His name is Victor Fink. He owned the art gallery where you were shot.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: He was there with me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was shot and killed.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about this man? Rocco Jones. He used to work at the gallery.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Guys, I feel so useless. Look, I'm really... I'm really sorry. I-- I just don't know him.

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: After all I did for you, Fink. I wasn't just your assistant, man. I broke the law for you, and you think you can just fire me? I should kill you, man. Just pop you right in the back. Bang! And you're dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whew. Wow. So, you finally get the courage to do it there, Rocco?

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: Dude, come on. I was mad. I was just blowing off steam.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You said you broke the law for him. How? Fine by me, pal. You have a nice trial.

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: Come on. What... What the hell are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You threatened a guy. Then he turns up dead. Do the math.

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: Forgeries. Fink paid me to paint forgeries of high-end paintings. I was struggling, man. I needed the dough.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What'd he do with the copies?

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: Sold them. Passed them along to the buyer like they were the real thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who did he sell to?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bahir Harun. He's an attaché at the Bahrain Consulate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bahrain? So, he's the one who talked to Fink an hour before he was murdered. Maybe he figured out Fink was selling fakes and decided to get even.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Doesn't matter. The guy has full diplomatic immunity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, I checked all the photo IDs off all of Fink's clients and artists. Our friend J isn't one of them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then what was he doing at the gallery?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Holloway called from the hospital. Aside from a minor head bump, J's got a clean bill of health. Well, other than the memory loss.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, why don't you guys grab J, take him down to the crime scene. See if that sparks his memory. And get a hold of Fink's assistant Darius. Tell him to meet you down there, with every file he has on Bahir Harun.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: And you're sure I was here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Take your time. No pressure.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Isn't this supposed to be where I get a headache and flashes of memory start overwhelming me until all the pieces come together?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, you've seen too many movies.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Yeah, that I can't remember.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wow. That's very chicken-egg.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Welcome to my world.

utterance.speaker: DARIUS LANGLEY
utterance.content: Weird, that someone can just lose his mind like that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you sure you don't recognize him?

utterance.speaker: DARIUS LANGLEY
utterance.content: I don't think so. But I've only been here a few months. Anyway, here's everything I could find on Mr. Harun. All purchases going back three years. I still can't believe Fink was trafficking in forgeries.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Harun's purchases from Fink.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's dozens of paintings.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. And according to Fink's old assistant, Rocco, any and all of these could have been forgeries.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is a Jules Matterson. This is worth $100,000, easy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but you only pay Rocco a grand to knock it off.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Fink could've ripped Harun off for millions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who says crime doesn't pay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Someone took me for that much, I could see putting a bullet in his back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that explains why Harun went after Fink. But what about J?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to talk to Harun.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Beckett, I hate diplomatic immunity as much as the next cop, but as far as you're concerned, forget the guy. I put in an interview request. Now it's in the State Department's hands. Period.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. But, sir, what about the other victim?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Guy with amnesia. So?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He has nowhere to go tonight.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Well, turn him over to Social Services. State's problem, not ours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know, sir, but he'll probably end up in a homeless shelter. He's a person of interest and a potential witness. I would hate to lose him to the system.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Okay. But my couch is off limits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, sir.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It's not The Plaza, but I have snuck many a power nap on this couch over the years. You should sleep just fine.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: I'm grateful not to have to go anywhere with strangers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's not a problem.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: You know, it's terrifying to think that someone actually tried to kill me, and I don't know who it was, or why. And they're still out there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That's why we're gonna catch the bastard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But to do that, we need to find out who you are. So we're gonna release your photograph to the media tomorrow morning.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: What if nobody recognizes it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I'm sure someone will.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: But what if no one does and I don't remember? Then who am I?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I promise you, we won't give up on you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: My science teacher says that chocolate contains chemicals that are proven to relieve depression.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, it's good, but I prefer grape, aged, bottled and corked.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You're having an ice cream tasting and no one called, texted or tweeted?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gram broke it off with Chet, so I suggested sugar therapy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened to sunrise in Central Park?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Who am I kidding? It's a fairy tale.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what woman doesn't want a fairy tale?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: He's not who I thought he was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Million different little things. You know, doesn't drive, he's skinny. Oh, and he has this laugh like...

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I can't even do it. It's like a honking goose, kind of...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These are sitcom reasons for breaking up. This morning you were in love. What possibly could have happened?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, back off. The spark died. She's obviously reconsidered.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: That's right. And now we're going through the five flavors of grieving.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is the first stage accepting the ice cream?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then I'm in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey! Morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. How was he last night?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He slept like a rock. Doc Holloway stopped by this morning to give him a cognitive abilities test. Scored through the roof on the quantitative part.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He's good at math, maybe he was an engineer, or in accounting or financing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or just good at math. Castle's testing his drawing abilities. See if he's an artist. Maybe he was trying to convince Fink to show his work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I suppose we should be thankful he didn't offer to pose nude.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Thanks for that. Hey, any idea if we're gonna get to talk to that attaché, Harun?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Radio silence. We gotta ID J.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Speak of the devil.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. They've been showing it all morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any calls yet?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, until we figure out who he is, we've got nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, what's the verdict?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You really captured his soul.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so you're not an artist. I'm sure you have many other talents.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Just not a talent for remembering them.

utterance.speaker: TORY WESTCHESTER
utterance.content: Oh, that's him. No, no, that's him! Oh, thank God.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think we're about to find out who you are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you recognize her?

utterance.speaker: TORY WESTCHESTER
utterance.content: Yes, it's him.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: No. But then again, I don't recognize myself In the mirror.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Go ahead, ma'am.

utterance.speaker: TORY WESTCHESTER
utterance.content: Thanks. Joel! Oh, my God!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tory Westchester. Wife.

utterance.speaker: TORY WESTCHESTER
utterance.content: I was so scared I lost you. Oh, sweetie. So, it's true? You really don't remember anything?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He's suffering from amnesia.

utterance.speaker: TORY WESTCHESTER
utterance.content: I knew something was wrong. I knew it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: J, are you crying?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: I think I am.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you feel a connection?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Yeah. It's actually pretty overwhelming.

utterance.speaker: TORY WESTCHESTER
utterance.content: Of course it is, baby. I love you so much. We will get through this, whatever it takes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, Ms. Westchester, how long have the two of you been married?

utterance.speaker: TORY WESTCHESTER
utterance.content: Two years, this past October.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you said his name was Joel...

utterance.speaker: TORY WESTCHESTER
utterance.content: Joel Westchester. Oh, honey, look at you. You do remember me.

utterance.speaker: TORY WESTCHESTER
utterance.content: Love conquers all! Oh, it's all gonna be fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: TORY WESTCHESTER
utterance.content: What is it? What is it, my darling?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think he's having an asthma attack.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You have an inhaler in your pocket. Get it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ms. Westchester, do you have cats?

utterance.speaker: TORY WESTCHESTER
utterance.content: Eight, like Jon and Kate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think Joel here is allergic to cats.

utterance.speaker: TORY WESTCHESTER
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Westchester, you're not really married to him, are you?

utterance.speaker: TORY WESTCHESTER
utterance.content: I could be. I so could be! Why the hell shouldn't I be?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She's been in and out of mental facilities for more than ten years. Every personality disorder in the book. Sorry about that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just another contestant on Who Wants To Marry An Amnesiac?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Beckett. Your attaché, Mr. Harun, he's on his way down. He agreed to talk.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He just showed up voluntarily?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He wants to stay in control.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This could be our only shot. Let's make sure that Harun gets a good look at our friend J.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Inadvertent, of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Harun thinks that he killed J, then his reaction could tell us everything we need to know. Let's go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Harun, you were a client of Mr. Fink's?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: That's correct.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You bought a significant number of works from him.

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we believe that many of those works were forgeries.

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: That's correct.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you're saying that you knew they were fakes?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: Of course I knew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you bought them anyway?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: I have many friends back home whose wives are, how shall we say, um, demanding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what do demanding wives have to do with any of this?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: Well, we all know that the fairer sex can be shallow. Not you, of course, Detective. A smart, liberated, American woman. But my friends' wives, they want a bag that says "Gucci." They don't care who made the bag, as long as it has that signature. And it's the same with paintings. They are more appreciative of the signature than of the work itself. And my friends don't always want to spend top dollar on authentic pieces. So Victor would commission a copy, my friends save money, I get rich, and the wives get to think they have...

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, move to your left just a drop.

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: ...extravagant artwork on their walls. Everyone's happy.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: ...And no one's broken the law.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, you only bought fakes from Fink?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: No. He would also source originals for those husbands with taste. I was happy to provide...

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He look familiar?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: ...even though originals pay less. What with everyone wanting fair market value and all.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: No. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The night that Mr. Fink was murdered, you called him not long before he was killed.

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: That's correct, Detective. He-- he told me to come by, that he had a painting for me. I showed up around 9:45, but he sent me away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sent you away?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: Yes. He was arguing with a man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: I have no idea. I respected his wishes and went for dinner at Nobu.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think your could describe this man?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: Please. Must we continue with this ridiculous charade when we both know he is standing right there.

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: Now, if that is all...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Harun, I'm not quite done yet.

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: Ah. But I am. Have a nice day.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For a guy with diplomatic immunity, he wasn't very diplomatic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Harun's hiding behind his immunity. He knows more than he's saying.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe, but his alibi is good. Nobu has him on security video entering at 9:55 p.m., 19 minutes before the 911 call about shots fired. He's not our guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, just because he didn't pull the trigger, doesn't mean he wasn't involved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And just because J was shot doesn't mean he wasn't into something shady. Could be the reason he was shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Harun said he saw J arguing with Fink.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We need to figure out why J was at the gallery.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And we can't do that if we don't know who the hell he is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We've been through this, it's just a bunch of junk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But if we take a look at everything we know about him collectively, maybe a picture will emerge.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nothing distinctive about these keys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, and that plastic bag really narrows it down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, he's got asthma, he's allergic to cats, he reads.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And he's good at math and he can't draw. Put it together, he's your average asthmatic mathlete with a lot of crap in his pockets.

utterance.speaker: UNIFORM
utterance.content: Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. It's from Lanie. It's the forensics report on his coat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe his driver's license was sewn into the lining.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gun powder residue.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, he was shot at close range.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. Coffee stain, sugar granules, traces of milk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We know how he takes his coffee.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Animal hairs.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not cat hairs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How could I have missed this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Missed what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know what this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, it's a grocery bag.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it's not just a grocery bag, it's the bag that's gonna tell us exactly who J is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why are you dragging me back to the art gallery?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not to the art gallery, to the street. Ah! It's gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What's gone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The dog. That's why he had the bag. To clean up after his dog.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know it was his dog?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, why else would he have a bag? Why else would there be a dog tied up outside a commercial building after midnight? Maybe someone stole it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get me Animal Control.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Aw. Who's a good girl?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's Fink's gallery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good girl. Lucy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your name is Jeremy Preswick. We checked it against your DMV photo and it's a positive ID.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Jeremy Preswick.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You are 34 years old, and you live at 82 Warren Street in Tribeca. You don't really have any family. Your parents passed away a few years ago, and you don't have any siblings. But we did manage to get ahold of your ex-wife, Emma Carnes.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Ex-wife?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: I'm divorced?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Sorry. Your ex sounded pretty concerned, and we figured that would be the fastest way of putting together the details, which would be great for you and for our investigation.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: If you think it'll help.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: An ex-wife that I can't remember.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, some men would consider you lucky.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Thanks. Hello, Jeremy.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Hey. Thank you for coming. I appreciate it.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: So, we're divorced.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Must be weird coming here to try to help me out, huh?

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: A little.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Please take a seat.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: So what happened to him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's what we are trying to figure out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there anything you can tell us about Jeremy?

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Well, like what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like, uh, where he works.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Well, as far as I know, he doesn't anymore. Okay, this is weird with you sitting right there.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Tell me about it.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: You have a PhD in economics from Wharton. Uh, you had a consulting business in channel economics and strategy. You're smart. Like, crazy smart.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Had a business?

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, he sold it last year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know why?

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: No. I thought it was weird. He loved the business.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Why did we split up?

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Wow. I've ranted for hours to girlfriends about that.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: I'm guessing I don't come off so well in that rant.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: You were a jerk.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: But so was I. I mean, the truth is we probably got married too young.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Look, I'm sorry that I don't recognize you, but you seem incredibly nice and you're gorgeous, and I'm certain that it was entirely my fault that our marriage fell apart.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: See that. That's the guy I fell in love with. Funny. Sweet. Self-deprecating.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know what Jeremy had been doing with himself recently?

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: As far as I know, he was dating the youngest, hottest women he could find, and not bothering to put the toilet seat down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And do you have any idea what he might have been doing at the Victor Fink Gallery in Chelsea?

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: No. I'm sorry, but we haven't even spoken in almost a year.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, well we're on our way to Jeremy's apartment to see if it sparks anything. Would you mind coming along? You might be able to put things in some context.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look familiar?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Nope. You can say it. I'm the worst witness ever.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You're doing fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. A wallet. Well, I don't think you were mugged.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you mind if I poke around, open some drawers?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Mi casa ... es tu casa. Hey, look at that. Rocking the Spanish.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: We did junior year in Madrid.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Sounds nice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here's the rest of your Russian literature collection. You are a very ambitious reader, Mr. Preswick.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: You always wanted more time to read.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Guess I'm gonna have to start over now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's not such a bad thing. What I wouldn't give to read The Cask of Amontillado for the first time. Or any Stephen King. Ah. Silver lining. You get to read all my books for the first time again.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Anything?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's pretty sparse. Like a guy who spent a lot of time alone.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Yeah, I thought you'd have more of a slick pad. Done up with more stuff.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Taglia. This is a pretty pricey painting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Emma, do you know if Jeremy bought that painting at a gallery in the city?

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: No. We bought that together on our honeymoon in Siena. I can't believe you still have it.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Well, part of the divorce settlement was to sell it and split the cash. It appraised for over 200 grand. You sent me my half.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: That's funny. There's something about it that's so familiar. Or maybe I just like it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's a 9 millimeter. Five bullets missing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, ballistics confirmed that the gun found in Jeremy's apartment was the same one that was used to kill Fink. And we just need to know if it's possible that Jeremy was the shooter.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: CSU did find gun residue on his coat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that just means that he was shot at close range.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like, if Jeremy were holding the gun, struggled with Fink, Fink managed to turn the gun around and it went off?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: These abrasions on Fink's wrists are certainly consistent with that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, then why would he have left the gun in his apartment?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Doc Holloway said he was probably in a fugue state, like sleep-walking. He could have dropped the gun off, and then went back out again.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay, am I missing something? I thought you're supposed to be happy after you caught the killer.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Why'd I do it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don't know why. You'll be appointed a lawyer. I know that Emma wants to help hire someone, and I don't think money will be an issue.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Well, thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don't know why you're thanking me, Mr. Preswick. We just arrested you for murder.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Yeah. Well, it's not your fault. You guys have been nothing but incredibly nice to a babbling idiot who thought he was a victim. It's like I tricked you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good luck, Jeremy.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Hey, if you figure it out, would you let me know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: I just think it'd be easier, knowing why.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The guy is guilty of a murder he can't remember. That just sucks. I mean, if you're gonna kill someone, get caught, spend the rest of your life in prison, at least you have the satisfaction of knowing why you did it. Hatred. Revenge. Hell, maybe he even cut you off on the highway. But Jeremy won't even have that, even if we do find motive, because he won't remember why it meant anything to him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm with you, Castle. It sucks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, what next?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We, uh, submit the paperwork to the DA.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But the DA will need motive, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nope. Evidence speaks. Smoking gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But don't you want to know why he did it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but the truth is, is that we don't need it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The DA doesn't need it. But you and me? I know I couldn't sleep last night, could you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There's got to be an answer here. Something in his life that makes it all make sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hands! Show...!

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Oh, that gets the heart rate going.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Carnes, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Getting Lucy's things. Prescription. Guess I have custody now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm sorry to surprise you. We didn't know you'd be here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Yeah. I guess I just thought for half a second that this would be a bizarre second chance for Jer and me. Stupid, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it's not stupid. And to find out that he's a murderer...

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: When I saw him again, I... All those years of petty arguments that tore us apart didn't seem to matter. It was-- it was like we first met. You know, I felt that thing. And then we came here, and I saw that he didn't sell it and I thought maybe he still had feelings for me, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you mean the painting that the two of you bought on your honeymoon?

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: We didn't buy it because we wanted to. We had to. We were in the artist's studio in Siena and Jeremy picked it up off the easel. He was always goofing around. The artist went crazy. It was still drying. We laughed for a week about our little love smudge. And then when I saw that he didn't sell it, I thought maybe... But I was kidding myself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: No thumbprint. It should be right here. He sold ours. This one's just a copy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Carnes, are you sure?

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Of course I'm sure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's a fake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And we know who dealt in fakes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's got to be Jeremy's connection to Fink. That's got to be why Jeremy was at the gallery.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if Jeremy and Fink were arguing like Harun said, maybe it was over the original.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And if that's a fake, then where is the original?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: ...deux semaines. Absolutely, and...

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: Careful with that one. Oui. Oui, merci. A bientot, alors.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Leaving us so soon, Mr. Harun?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: Oh, what now? I have a plane to catch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Make any interesting art acquisitions on this trip?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: Actually, yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mind if we take a look?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I just don't have the time

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Make time.

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: What part of diplomatic immunity are you not clear on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: See, every time you say something like that, it makes me think that you have something to hide.

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: Well, it's too bad that you will never find out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: License and registration, please.

utterance.speaker: DRIVER
utterance.content: What? Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You are double-parked.

utterance.speaker: DRIVER
utterance.content: This is New York. Everyone double-parks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is he resisting arrest?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I believe so. Step over here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm gonna have to search your car.

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: You have no right to do this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don't see any diplomatic plates. And immunity doesn't extend to a car service.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Harun, this can go one of two ways. You can either cooperate and tell me what I need to know, or I can call the State Department and inform them that you have a piece of artwork that's at the center of our murder investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And the last I checked, the New York tabloids could give a rat's ass about your diplomatic status. They'll just print your photograph with a headline that says "Diplomatic Douchebag."

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: Fine. What would you like to know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There's a fake version of this painting found in one of our shooting victim's apartments. Can you tell us how it got there?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: How would I know this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because the fake painting is where the real painting used to be. And now you have the real painting.

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: All I know is that I asked Fink to acquire it for client of mine. When he said he had it, I assumed he tracked down the owner and made a deal. But when I went to the gallery that evening, he sent me away. Just like I told you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's a great story, Mr. Harun. But if Fink sent you away empty-handed, why do you have the painting?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: Because I got a call from a man this morning that said he had it, for a price.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who was it?

utterance.speaker: BAHIR HARUN
utterance.content: It was Fink's new assistant. Darius.

utterance.speaker: DARIUS LANGLEY
utterance.content: This is crazy. I told you already, I was in class when Mr. Fink was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nobody remembers seeing you there.

utterance.speaker: DARIUS LANGLEY
utterance.content: I sat in the back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The naughty kids always do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were at the gallery the night that Jeremy confronted Fink about the painting.

utterance.speaker: DARIUS LANGLEY
utterance.content: Listen, there's obviously been some kind of misunderstanding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was this a misunderstanding, as well? It's a signed statement from the super at Preswick's building, admitting that he took a $1,000 bribe from you to allow you into Jeremy's apartment so that you could switch out the paintings.

utterance.speaker: DARIUS LANGLEY
utterance.content: I'm sorry. Should've come clean from the start. Fink wanted the painting. He told me to buy it from Preswick, but the guy wouldn't sell. So Fink had me paint a fake and, yeah, I-- I bribed the super to switch it with the real thing. It was stupid, but Fink threatened to fire me if I didn't.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was all you, Darius. You switched out the paintings, you pocketed the money that Fink gave you to buy it.

utterance.speaker: DARIUS LANGLEY
utterance.content: It was Fink. He manipulated me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. That is just a lie. And you know what else is a lie? Your name. Darius Langley is your roommate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pretty smart using his identity to land a job at the gallery. Well, I guess it'd be pretty tough to get hired with two felony counts of counterfeiting now, isn't it, George?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You got quite a rap sheet, Mr. Heller.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. One more strike, you go away for a long time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is why you couldn't afford Preswick calling the cops when he found out the truth. So you shot him. And then when he went down, you shot Fink, as well.

utterance.speaker: GEORGE HELLER
utterance.content: Think you're gonna pin this murder on me? No way. You don't got jack.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Read carefully. You bribed the super twice. And the second time was four hours after Detectives Ryan and Esposito brought Preswick to the gallery and you realized that he had lost his memory. You planted the gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Swing and a miss. Strike three. You're out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah. It's a beaut.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Isn't it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I especially love the fingerprint.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Me, too. Even if I can't remember, it still somehow feels a part of me.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Hey, Jer. Ready to rock?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Thanks for coming.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: You remember Lucy?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She certainly remembers you.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Well, hey, thanks, guys. You made getting arrested for murder really not so bad. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, are you two gonna...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: It's okay. The answer is, who knows? I like him and he likes me. And right now, that's enough.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Well, see you. I guess if I ever lose my memory again, I'll know where to come.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Thanks. Later.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Thanks again for coming.

utterance.speaker: EMMA CARNES
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY PRESWICK
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: One of them has 15 years of baggage. Marriage. Divorce. The other's on a first date. How long you think that'll last?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hopefully for a long time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why, Detective Beckett, I had no idea you were a romantic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I also sleep with a gun. Bet you didn't know that either.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How about you, Castle? How long you think it'll last?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I guess it's just the writer in me, but I'm hoping for a happy ending.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ooh! Well, well, well. Look who's doing the walk of shame now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was with Beckett.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, wrapping up a case.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah. Well, you should kiss that girl while you're both young.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's going on with you? What do you got there?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh. It's from Chet. Isn't it romantic?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Chet sent you a dead flower?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It is the most romantic thing that anyone had ever done for me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I've been up all night, so I might be a little slow.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, it's the boutonniere I gave him, prom night. He saved it, tucked it into a yearbook, and he sent it over last night with a note saying, would I give-- give him a second chance?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, there's a lot of that going around these days.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And I'm scared. I mean, what if it doesn't work out? What if it does?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's the cost of living.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I just don't want to ruin this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is dead. You are not. Time to start making some new memories.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Boy, how did you get so smart?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It must be my dad.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Dad.
